title: Azir Q&A: Creative - COMPLETED
body:
http://news.cdn.leagueoflegends.com/public/images/are/img/ar-wallpaper.jpg

**EDIT - Alright guys, we're headed back to work. Thanks for all the questions!**

HELLO, EVERYONE
Narrative team & others are here to answer your questions about Azir and his place in Shurima. Like, "How does he keep his feathers so well-groomed?" and, "How does a bird like him survive in the desert?" (You'll have better questions. I promise.)

We'll be answering questions until the end of the day.

Here are some other things you ~~might want to~~ **should** check out:
[Azir Reveal](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/champion-reveal/azir-emperor-of-the-sands)
[Shurima: What Lies Beneath the Sands?](http://promo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/shurima/index.html)

[Azir Art & Sound Q&A](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/9f9inmau-azir-qa-art-sound)
[Azir Gameplay Q&A](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/sixv1VVL-azir-qa-gameplay)

replies.body:
Look I know most of this stuff already, but I missed out on everything after "I get locked in a tomb with a living night light." 

1) They said Azir was dusted after the ritual went wrong. How is it that we have to suffer his obnoxious, overbearing presence again? I mean, I knew a guy who had the same thing happen to him (minus the betrayal). Only thing he ascended into was a cloud of atomic particles.

2) Why's everyone making such a big deal about this, anyway? I'm already part of the league. Coolness factor as maximum capacity. Tell him to leave.

3) Apparently Shurima fell while I was gone. What the fuck, Nasus? 

4) Did anyone feed my goldfish? Or did he ascend as well, since everyone's fucking ascending now?

5) How long did Nasus feign sorrow over what he had to do? Did he immediately go into my room and touch my stuff? What did he take? Tell him I want it back and I'm going to kill him.

Thanks for your time, but thank me for mine most of all.
Ren bot with the hard hitting questions
Would you say Azir was the kind of ruler that people** flocked** to?
HEH

So this may clash with gameplay but:
How does it work out that a great emperor, who doesn't even bother attacking himself, dashes to one of his lowly soldiers? I feel like a dash was decided to be mandatory on his kit to make him safer but it doesn't quite fit into his fantasy, imo.

The dash, to me, is a more aggressive skill that just so happens to double as an escape. Using E on a soldier that's near a champion knocks the champion up briefly and grants you a shield, great for initiating and closing gaps. So, I see it as an Emperor coming to the aid of his soldiers, soldiers scouting an area for him, as well as him using them as a means of escape.

Kinda like Azir saying "Soldier, check that area for me!"

The soldier than saying, despite being a sand construct "All clear Emperor!" or "Enemies my liege!"

Then Azir comes over, being all "Fantastic, let's move out!" or "I'm here Soldiers, let us fight these wretched villains!"
Was he always so...birdy? I mean he has fabulous legs but I wonder were they like that when he was young and...alive?
No, he was human originally. But I also think he has fabulous legs. :P
Nope. When he was human, he had regular old legs that bent the normal way. :-)

What does Azir think of Yordles?
Does Azir know Anivia at all or have any relation to her?
Did Azir ALWAYS love birds?

Azir would welcome their furry enthusiasm, provided they directed it toward expanding Shurima's greatness.

Azir was once human, so he's a great deal younger than Anivia. Nasus on the other hand...

Birds soar to great heights, I can't help but think Azir would admire that.

Also, Anivia X Azir OTP. Take that Valor.

Why does Cassiopeia want to serve Azir/shiruma and betray her family, thus having katarina and talon come after her for betraying the Du Couteau family, and Darius come after her for betraying Noxus. AND swain come after her because Darius is coming after her, AND FINALLY, with swaim, the entire Noxian army since he, Darius, Katarina, and Talon all probably have enough influence to marshall it.

Also, Why Cassiopeia lore change?

Cass has very little interest in serving Azir or Shurima. She is certainly still Noxian and loyal to her family; she went into Shurima searching for wealth and power for her, her family and Noxus. As seen from the video today, she just didn't get what she bargained for.

How long has Azir been in the works?

We know the Sand Mage was an idea kicked around for a long time, but when did the Eygyptian Ra-esque Bird Emperor become the settled upon concept for the Sand Mage Archetype? Time line specifics much appreciated :D

For three years, I believe. I think it started with a kit. Someone might have to correct me on that, though. He became the bird emperor you know today about a year and a half ago.

**EDIT: NOPE I was wrong. Runaan corrected me. She pitched him as a character over three years ago. It wasn't a kit, first.**

if he is 3 years old in terms of development you could have spent 3 months making character lore more than just a character description

if it isn't going to be lore anymore just rename it to character description.
He has a full story coming, but it'd spoil the rest of the Shurima event. So we're waiting to reveal it until you guys see the full story.

To clarify, he started out as a really loose idea of a "sand mage" - Ezreal and I liked the idea of a sand dude who could sort of "envelop" people with the desert itself. The emperor idea came out of this, but the original kit/art direction weren't working, so we went back to iteration town. We really knew what we wanted to do when the idea of "Ascended" Azir came about (yes, we were the most excited when we decided to make him a bird guy). :) From there, it took a lot of iteration to capitalize on the personality of an emperor as well as the game play - and here we are today!

Thanks Runaan!
Can I ask what the original art direction was? Or is that IP with potential use that needs to stay hush hush.
He was kind of just a dude that happened to be made of sand (a bit Brand-esque; replace fire with sand). It was a decent start, but we knew we could push it further. :)

I HAD A IMPORTANT QUESTION, WHY DID AZIR JOIN THE LEAGUE? hehehe.

Now, the real question, if the ascension reliq was used in the past... did that mean nasus, Renekton and azir are not the only furry ascended people on valoran?

>I HAD A IMPORTANT QUESTION, WHY DID AZIR JOIN THE LEAGUE? hehehe.

;_____________;

>Now, the real question, if the ascension reliq was used in the past... did that mean nasus, Renekton and azir are not the only furry ascended people on valoran?

Entirely possible! They haven't shown their faces lately, though, if there are others out there.

I get the feeling that, according to Riot, Xerath went from a mage curious about how much arcane power he could actually control to a clone of Jafar from *Aladdin*, a power hungry subordinate who stole it at the most opportune moment.

Is this really how an otherwise interesting character be transformed?
I wouldn't say so. Keep in mind we may not know everything there is to know about Xerath just yet.

> a clone of Jafar from Aladdin

(Tommy Gnox) (Aside) "Hey guys, uh, are we sure we want to go ahead with his snarky parrot sidekick? I think they're onto us."
Hey, IronStylus has his faults, but you don't have to snipe him.

Bit of topic and not totally about Azir. I was wondering, I Xerath full evil now. It's just that, as some one who plays and loved Xerath's lore he never struck me as evil. All he wanted was to learn the truth of magic. I would love to see more of Xerath reasons behind why he took the ascension ritual from Azir and the subsequent fallout.

I would like to ask something lore wise, and not just about Azir, but about every champion related to Shurima in one way, shape, or form.

In the client, you have reduced these champion's lore to a very short paragraph, whereas before, they were practically stories in of themselves. Are these lore changes simply placeholders for future lore additions, or is this the beginning of the not-so-well-received announcement of the disconnect between the game and the lore?

If its the former, I will gladly wait for those additions. If its the latter, will there be a separate website you guys will develop that will hold the entire story of not only Shurima, but Runeterra as a whole?
Sure thing. Those client blurbs are intended to stay on the client only, and a longer story will be on the website. They'll be updated in time. :D

After being updated again you couldn't put a link such as "read more here"? 
So people who don't know that in the website there are a complete and detailed story can find out and go read!
Huh? They haven't been updated with longer-form bios yet. Especially not Azir's, as that would spoil the Shurima event. Once it's updated you'll be able to get it through the client.
Hey Opeli could you drop us a line when the longer versions of the Bios come out for the main site? We really wanna read 'em!

Why can't Azir just let go his lost empire?

What he gonna rule there anyway, sands? Though I can somehow see him modeling his whole empire with sand then play empire in his head.

Now I kinda got sad for him...

He can't let go because he truly loved his nation, however much his ambition may have led him astray. He can't accept responsibility for what happened to his kingdom - he blames Xerath, but was it really Xerath's fault...? Or was it the emperor who couldn't see the cruel intent of his most trusted advisor - and friend? :O

And yes - for the moment, he is an emperor without an empire. An emperor without a people. He has nothing - but he'll do everything with his newfound power to change that, and rebuild Shurima into the thriving, powerful empire it once was.
Please tell me you guys drew from The Mummy movies, at least a little.
I love the first one, especially.

He was blind to it. He totally trusted Xerath. :(

>(Funny questions)
>-Does Azir sleep in a bed or a nest? If it's a nest, what's it made of?

I don't think he sleeps! At all!

As a gamer studying marketing and design, what sort of data influences your design decisions when creating a new champion like Azir?  I hope that one day I can work with you guys, so I'd be really interested in getting some insight as to how if at all the creative teams work with other functional teams to develop new characters.

It's not so much data as inspiration. The initial idea can come from anywhere -- often it starts as an artist's sketch -- and gets ideated and iterated on by pods of gameplay designers, artists, and narrative writers over a period of many months. The strength of this approach is that all three aspects of each champion are developed in concert and constant dialogue with each other, so the end result hopefully feels thoroughly integrated and whole. To some degree we also look at evident gaps in our champion roster when conceiving and slotting upcoming champs (not enough tanks, not enough beasts, etc.).
When you created a sandmage, what brought you to the concept of controlling soldiers?
The fantasy of being an emperor. As an emperor, you have soldiers fighting wars for you, and you'd command them - so we went with controlling soldiers. :)

I have a philosophical question:

Is Nasus right? Was Shurima meant to fall?

I always liked that line in his VO, and I like the idea that Shurima was an unsustainable metropolis (probably seen as a utopia at least by some), but I am curious to see what exactly were the flaws that led to Shurima's downfall.
Letting Nasus lock its greatest hero inside a tomb for a billion years when he could have gone instead.

Here's a question for ya:

Given the fact that the Shurimans aren't the only sun revering culture, what does Azir think of Mount Targon and the Solari?
At the very least, intrigued. Though one can't help but wonder if once the whole "You like the Sun? Me too!" phase passes they might have some serious differences to sort out.
Azir isn't currently aware of it, but there's little doubt that he will be greatly interested by Mount Targon.
How many times did you have to say the name "Shurima" while writing Azir's lore and quotes (if you write the quotes)?
